an5.38:4.1: “Mendicants, a faithful person from a good family gets five benefits.
an5.38:4.3: The good persons in the world show compassion first to the faithful, not so much to the unfaithful.
an5.38:4.4: They first approach the faithful, not so much the unfaithful.
an5.38:4.5: They first receive alms from the faithful, not so much the unfaithful.
an5.38:4.6: They first teach Dharma to the faithful, not so much the unfaithful.
an5.38:4.7: When their body breaks up, after death, the faithful are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an5.38:4.8: A faithful person from a good family gets these five benefits.
an5.38:5.1: Suppose there was a great banyan tree at a level crossroads. It would become a refuge for birds from all around.
an5.38:5.2: In the same way, a faithful person from a good family becomes a refuge for many people—monks, nuns, laywomen, and laymen.”
an5.38:6.2: a great tree with its strong trunk,
an5.38:7.3: Those that need shade go in the shade,
an5.38:7.4: those that need fruit enjoy the fruit.
an5.38:9.1: Those free of greed, freed of hate,
an5.38:9.3: fields of merit for the world,
